definitions.example: Tweezers are great for manipulating small items.

definitions.definition: (by extension) An object that can be picked up for later use.
A line of text having a legal or other meaning; a separate particular in an account.
definitions.example: In response to the first item, we deny all wrongdoing.

definitions.definition: (psychometrics) A question on a test, which may include its answers.
definitions.example: The exam has 100 items, each of which includes a correct response and three distractors.

definitions.definition: A matter for discussion in an agenda.
definitions.example: The first item for discussion is the budget for next year's picnic.

definitions.definition: Two people who are having a relationship with each other.
definitions.example: Jack and Jill are an item.

definitions.definition: A short article in a newspaper.
